com.ardic.android.iotignite.interfaces

Interface INode

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Node

    public interface INode
    Node is the parent of Thing's. You can group your Thing's with specified Node's to easily control them. Every Node in device must be has an unique id.
    Author:
    ARDIC
    See Also:
    Thing, ThingManager, IotIgniteManager

        Returns:

      • setNodeID

        void setNodeID(String nodeID)
        Set an id to Node. ID must be UNIQUE.
        Parameters:
        nodeID -

        Set Context of Node.

      • register

        boolean register()
        Register Node to IotIgnite. To register Node, nodeID must be unique on this device.
        Returns:
        true or false success state.

      • unregister

        boolean unregister()
        Unregister Node from IotIgnite. The application can only unregister it's own Node's. The other Node's registered by different application can not be reachable.
        Returns:
        true or false success state.
        See Also:
        IotIgniteManager, Thing

      • createThing

        Thing createThing(String thingID,
                  ThingType thingType,
                  ThingCategory thingCategory,
                  boolean isActuator,
                  ThingListener listener)
        Creates Thing object and assigns to Node. To create Thing object the application must be authorized to IotIgnite platform.After that it can create Node and Node assigned Thing objects.
        Parameters:
        thingID -
        thingType -
        thingCategory -
        isActuator -
        listener -
        Returns:
        Thing : The created Thing object.
        See Also:
        ThingManager, Thing, ThingType, ThingListener, ThingCategory

      • createThing

        Thing createThing(android.hardware.Sensor androidSensor,
                  ThingListener listener)
        Create Thing object which an android Sensor. It wraps android Sensor to Thing object. Creating Thing objects from builtin android Sensor has fewer parameter than generic Thing object. It only need android Sensor and ThingListener. Other parameters such as thingID ,thingType , vendor has already been in Sensor.
      • Android Sensor's can not act as an actuator so by default this parameter is false. And the application cannot change it.
Parameters:
androidSensor -
listener -
Returns:
Thing : Thing object.
See Also:
ThingManager, Thing, Sensor, ThingListener

  • getEveryThing

    List<Thing> getEveryThing()
    Get list of registered Thing's in IotIgnite If no such a Thing in registered Node returns empty list.
    Returns:
    List<Thing> : List of Thing's which registered on IotIgnite.

  • getThingByID

    Thing getThingByID(String thingID)
    Get Thing object by thingID in registered Node. If no such a Thing like this thingID returns null object.
    Parameters:
    thingID - : Unique thingID of object.
    Returns:
    Thing : Returns null if no such a thing in that id.

  • getThingByName

    List<Thing> getThingByName(String name)
    Get list of registered Thing's which has same names in IotIgnite If no such a Thing in registered Node returns empty list.
    Parameters:
    name -
    Returns:
    List<Thing> : List of Thing's which has same thingName's registered on IotIgnite.

  • isRegistered

    boolean isRegistered()
    Check a Thing object registered on IotIgnite or not.
    Returns:
    true or false : Thing registration state on IotIgnite.
